ProteomicsExplorer 0.99.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Displays a correlation matrix of the quantitative data of a numeric matrix.

Source: R/mod_heatmap.R, R/plot_heatmap.R
heatmaps.Rd

xxxx

mod_ds_heatmap_ui(id)

mod_ds_heatmap_server(id, se, conds, width = 900)

heatmapD(data, conds, distfun = "euclidean", hclustfun = "complete")

mv.heatmap(
  x,
  col = grDevices::heat.colors(100),
  srtCol = NULL,
  labCol = NULL,
  labRow = NULL,
  key = TRUE,
  key.title = NULL,
  main = NULL,
  ylab = NULL
)

Arguments

id

xxx

se

xxx

conds

A character() of the conditions (one condition per sample).

width

xxx

data

A matrix or array quantitative values

distfun

A character(1) defining the distance used by the clustering algorithm to compute. Default value is 'euclidean'. See help(heatmap.2)

hclustfun

the clustering algorithm used to build the dendrogram. Default value is 'complete'. See help(heatmap.2)

x

A matrix or array containing the quantitative data.

col

Colors used for the image. Defaults to heat colors (heat.colors).

srtCol

Angle of column conds, in degrees from horizontal

labCol

Character vectors with column conds to use.

labRow

Character vectors with row conds to use.

key

Logical indicating whether a color-key should be shown.

key.title

Main title of the color key. If set to NA no title will be plotted.

main

Main title; default to none.

ylab

y-axis title; default to none.

Examples

library(QFeatures)
data(ft_na)
heatmapD(assay(ft_na, 1), colData(ft_na)$Condition)
#> Error in heatmapD(assay(ft_na, 1), colData(ft_na)$Condition): The length of 'conds' must be equal to the number of samples.
mv.heatmap(assay(ft_na, 1))


#------------------------------------------
# Shiny module
#------------------------------------------
if(interactive()){
data(ft)
 ui <- mod_ds_heatmap_ui('plot')

 server <- function(input, output, session) {
  mod_ds_heatmap_server('plot', 
  reactive({assay(ft, 1)}),
  colData(ft)$Condition
  )}
 
 shinyApp(ui=ui, server=server)
}
